solution_line_template: Since he fires his weapon on average every {fire_interval_seconds} seconds, then in one minute he fires the flamethrower {seconds_per_minute}/{fire_interval_seconds}=<<{seconds_per_minute}/{fire_interval_seconds}={times_fired_per_minute}>>{times_fired_per_minute} times.

And since each time he fires his weapon, he shoots flame for {flame_duration_seconds} seconds, then Jason shoots flames at the dragon hoard a total of {times_fired_per_minute}*{flame_duration_seconds}=<<{times_fired_per_minute}*{flame_duration_seconds}={total_flame_seconds_per_minute}>>{total_flame_seconds_per_minute} seconds of every minute.
